page.title: 08THE MARY ROSE
page.content: A Visit to the Mary Rose. Also in The Dockyard is another interesting ship, the Mary Rose, flagship of Henry VIII. It sank in 1545 because it was top heavy and it was raised from the bed of The Solent in 1982. You have to queue for about half an hour. It costs 50p for children, Â£1 for adults or Â£2.50 for a family ticket. There is a galley way with lots of information about the ship and at the entrance a guide will meet you and take you to the ship via an air lock. Inside there is a lot of noise because they are building an observation platform. They are spraying the hull with fresh water to preserve it. They have now succeeded in turning the hull into an upright position. Later on they are hoping to preserve it with a special formula wax.
